Buddy.Action: Crawls out of Santa's bag smiling, showing innocent and friendly behavior
Is a human baby among elves, implicitly accepted and loved by Papa Elf who expressed love for him
Crawls out of Santa's big red bag on his own, displaying initiative and curiosity.
As a baby, unable to communicate or perform tasks typical for older characters; dependent on others.
Rides a tricycle with other elves laughing and playing with him
Recites the Code of Elves with sincerity, including 'THE BEST WAY TO SPREAD CHRISTMAS CHEER IS SINGING LOUD FOR ALL TO HEAR!'
Pounds tiny elves into the boards with brute force in hockey game, scoring overwhelmingly
Thanks Pom Pom and apologizes for his injury
Shows physical clumsiness despite good intentions
Attempts to put star on tree but causes accident and allows others to help
Shows vulnerability by fighting back tears when speaking to supervisor
Shares his disappointment and vulnerability about making only eighty-five toys, admitting his insecurities.
Dismisses encouragement and expresses frustration at feeling different and inadequate compared to others.
Runs off upset, accidentally injuring himself, showing emotional sincercity and sensitivity.
Reveals he only made eighty-five toys, far below the expected pace.
Expresses frustration about his lack of skill compared to other elves.
Despite low productivity, recognized by others for unique talents like changing batteries and being the only baritone in the choir.
Upset and runs off, physically tagging his head on the door frame and locking himself in a small bathroom.
Sobs alone in the bathroom and is vulnerable with Papa Elf, admits feeling like he lets everyone down.
Responds curtly 'Go away!' when Papa Elf asks if he's okay.
Asks politely for 'Buddy time' with Papa Elf after initial conflict, showing sincerity and desire for connection.
Shows innocent enthusiasm and curiosity about Santa's sleigh, respectfully asks to touch it.
Sobbing and washing his face in a tiny sink after locking himself in a cramped bathroom.
Apologizes to Papa Elf and asks for 'Buddy time' showing emotional awareness and willingness to communicate.
Expresses feelings of letting everyone down and doubts about living up to family legacy, demonstrating self-reflection but also a sense of insecurity.
Shows wonder and curiosity at seeing Santa’s sleigh and asks questions showing desire to understand.
Expresses shock and disbelief that people don't believe in Santa and defends the magic of Christmas sincerely.
Eagerly offers to help Papa Elf with the sleigh's motor mounts, showing willingness to assist and bond.
Questions Papa Elf about the source of magic and shows curiosity about the Christmas spirit.
Expresses disbelief when hearing that parents might be putting toys under the tree, showing his strong knowledge of Santa's work.
Immediately offers to help Papa Elf fix the motor mounts, demonstrating willingness and initiative.
Is repeatedly scared by the toy jack in the box at the testing station, suggesting some lack of experience or alertness in toy testing.
Tries to keep working cheerfully despite being startled repeatedly by the Jack in the Boxes popping.
Overhears Elves talking behind his back and shows visible shock and distress.
Remembers and painfully acknowledges his physical struggles fitting in with the elves.
Collapses on Pom Pom who immediately expresses concern and warmth, showing Buddy is trusted and cared for.
Turns the crank on the Jack in the Box toys correctly to make them pop and produce the tune.
Reacts with fright repeatedly to the toys popping out, showing a lack of emotional control or preparedness.
Takes a break after the repeated scares, asking permission from the supervisor.
Overhears elves talking behind his back, leading to a shocked and queasy reaction reflecting self-doubt or realization of his outsider status.
Acknowledges his physical awkwardness and differences via flashbacks showing his struggles fitting into elf-sized environments.
Collapses when feeling overwhelmed but shows some resilience by trying to speak and interacting with Pom Pom.
Opens up about his nightmare and feelings of not belonging; expresses vulnerability.
Becomes upset and emotional upon learning he is not an elf and questioning Papa Elf's role.
Quickly runs off after becoming overwhelmed, showing avoidance rather than engagement.
Expresses confusion and misunderstanding about his identity and background, not immediately comprehending the truth about himself.
Seeks to process complex emotional information by requesting 'Buddy time' to handle confusion and stress.
Listens to Jim's complaint and cracks his back for him without hesitation.
Shows empathy by understanding Jim's feelings about not having a father or being able to play catch.
Refuses to engage with friends inviting him to sing and pick berries, saying 'Not now Pipsy!!' somewhat brusquely.
Responds helpfully to Jim the Snowman's request for cracking his back.
Acknowledges his differences and expresses understanding and acceptance of his situation.
Dismisses invitations to sing and pick berries while focused on his goal.
Says goodbye warmly and affectionately to each Elf he passes in the workshop.
Expresses nervousness honestly about going to New York.
Expresses excitement about spending time with his dad, planning fun activities together.
Reacts with deep distress upon learning his father is on the naughty list, showing emotional sincerity and concern.
Shows confidence in his ability to bring Christmas spirit and potentially help his dad change.
Politely and enthusiastically says goodbye to everyone in the workshop, showing social awareness and confidence.
Expresses nervousness about going to New York and admits to having much to remember, indicating self-awareness but some lack of preparation.
Immediately accepts Santa's advice and seems eager to take on the journey despite the challenges, showing positive attitude and confidence.
Becomes overwhelmed emotionally when learning his father is on the naughty list, showing vulnerability but also strong emotional reaction.
Embraces Papa Elf and expresses sincere emotion by crying and saying he'll miss them.
Waves goodbye warmly to animals, calling them lovable woodland animals.
Endures an exhausting and lonely journey with determination, motivated by a photo of his father.
Uses his last ounce of strength to pull out the old photo of his father despite harsh physical conditions.
Cries and skips away from his family, showing emotional vulnerability.
Attempts to interact kindly with a wild raccoon by cornering it and offering a hug.
Continues to engage with the raccoon despite it warning him by hissing and ultimately biting him.
Attempts to greet strangers warmly with friendly greetings despite being ignored.
Waves back at a woman trying to hail a cab, showing friendliness.
Shows excitement and praise to the diner staff about their coffee despite their jaded attitude.
Plays with gum on the ground and eats it, showing a lack of social awareness rather than unfriendliness.
Nods and makes a playful but odd gesture after being insulted by a passerby.
Grabs newspaper and picks up dog crap on the sidewalk to be helpful to a dog walker.
Whistles happily in elevator among serious passengers, tries to brighten the atmosphere.
Presses all 75 elevator buttons playfully, despite passenger confusion.
Walks all day and night to find his dad, nervously and excitedly approaches him with a heartfelt improvised song and hugs him.
Approaches Walter nervously and awkwardly tries to explain himself and connect by attempting to sing a made-up song.
Keeps a friendly attitude and says 'You guys are strong!' to the security guards despite being thrown out.
Responds 'I'm okay! Thank you!' after being hit by a cab, showing politeness and positive disposition.
Approaches people openly and cheerfully, skipping happily toward Gimbels despite earlier rejection.
Claims to be the son of Walter without introduction, which causes discomfort and security intervention.
Politely responds to angry man in elevator, deflecting aggression with humor.
Accosts strangers in public bathroom to point out big toilets.
Eats candy canes enthusiastically in the store.
Obediently complies with elf manager's harsh reprimand without argument.
Smiles sincerely even when asked to tone it down.
Compliments Jovie sincerely and directly.
Analyzes the snow and suggests adding natural erosion and wind drift look, demonstrating knowledge of snow behavior.
Fails to suppress smiling when asked to frown, showing lack of emotional control.
Responds with enthusiasm and curiosity about Santa Claus, quickly shifting from skepticism to excitement.
Compliments Jovie genuinely and engages socially, indicating social confidence and initiative.
Misunderstands Jovie's sarcasm about 'drinking the Kool Aid,' showing naivety.
Encourages Jovie to sing loudly and spread Christmas cheer despite her discomfort.
Demonstrates singing loudly himself to show Jovie it is easy and nothing to fear.
Decorates Santa Land beautifully with a welcoming, loving sign.
Listens quietly and sincerely to Jovie's singing, joins in gently.
Reacts with surprise and confusion when kicked, shows no anger or retaliation.
Successfully finishes decorating Santa Land with great visual impact, using expensive merchandise effectively.
Follows angelic singing, showing curiosity and focus.
Joins Jovie’s singing from outside the shower, demonstrating enthusiasm but poor social awareness.
Is kicked by Jovie after awkwardly invading her privacy and reacts with confusion and fear.
Appears asleep and drooling in a public display, causing confusion to bystanders.
Pounds on window yelling for his dad trying to get his attention despite being ignored.
Skips past security guards with a present, tries to deliver a message of love to his dad, shows affection openly.
Acknowledges he might be in trouble but emphasizes love for his dad, being sincere and good-natured.
Glows with satisfaction seeing others happy with Santa Land attraction, shows investment in making others joyful.
Responds nervously and uncertainly when confronted by Jovie, allowing himself to be vulnerable.
Compliments Jovie sincerely by telling her she has the most beautiful voice in the whole world.
Seems sheepish and apologetic when caught in the woman's locker room, showing innocence and earnestness.
Shows genuine excitement and joy about Santa's arrival, with wide eyes and breathless excitement.
Challenges the fake Santa vehemently when he lies about being Santa, showing a protective nature toward truth and children.
When exposed to deceit by fake Santa, reacts with fury, which could be seen as a negative if excessive anger is considered; however, this appears protective rather than hostile.
Sheepishly admits he heard Jovie singing and compliments her sincerely, showing emotional intelligence and honesty.
Looks to the floor but then meets Jovie’s eyes and speaks sincerely, displaying social confidence and awareness.
Rushes eagerly to greet Santa, straightens uniform quickly, showing enthusiasm but also a degree of self-awareness and preparedness.
Confronts the fake Santa with a pointed, knowledgeable question about a personal detail, demonstrating critical thinking and confidence.
Fails to initially recognize or verify the legitimacy of Santa, showing naive trust before confrontation.
Accuses 'Santa' of being an imposter and protects the kids by exposing the fake beard, encouraging them to confront him.
Recognizes the fake Santa by his incorrect voice and smell, attacks to expose the imposter, and rallies the kids to confront him.
Reaches out to hold hands with Walter, showing a desire for connection despite rejection.
Eats cotton balls from jar despite being told not to, faking out Walter.
Shows childlike enthusiasm and friendliness with playful comments about the skeleton and asking to wear the doctor's headlamp.
Whispers that Walter got mad at him, indicating sensitivity and awareness of others' feelings.
Asks to eat sugar plums together and make gingerbread houses after the appointment, demonstrating warmth and affection.
Fake out Walter when he tries to stop him from eating cotton balls.
Pulls the paper roll off the examining table, causing a mess and tangling Walter and the doctor.
Questions reasons for actions and shows curiosity (e.g., asks about headlamp, skeleton), demonstrating engagement and some intelligence.
Keeps moving around despite doctor's request to sit still, disrupting the examination.
Cries loudly after finger prick but then quickly engages in playful conversation with the little girl, showing openness and friendliness.
Reassures the little girl by saying he will put in a good word with the big man for her Christmas wish.
Responds positively and without judgment to the little girl’s comment about being raised by humans, saying 'Cool.'
Shoves the doctor over and cries loudly when his finger is pricked, then eats the cotton ball on his finger.
Interacts kindly and confidently with a little girl, displaying social ease and lightheartedness despite the situation.
Misinterprets or ignores the pain and seriousness of the doctor's procedure (eating cotton ball, treating finger like dead).
Greets Emily with a big hug despite not knowing her, shows friendliness and enthusiasm.
Carefully and lovingly decorates the apartment to create a winter wonderland.
Asks politely ('pretty please') when requesting items like the Coke and maple syrup.
Chugs the entire two-liter bottle of Coke in front of the family, seeming oblivious to social norms.
Pours maple syrup over spaghetti, ignoring conventional eating norms and causing disgust.
Expresses desire to stay with the family forever, showing openness and affection.
Burps loudly and draws attention after being ignored by Michael.
Says 'I love you' to Michael despite being rebuffed, tries to play and engage.
Asks to be tucked in at night, showing vulnerability and trust.
Jokes about the four food groups being all sugary items, showing a lack of realistic knowledge about nutrition.
Plans to stay with the family indefinitely without a clear plan, indicating poor foresight and unrealistic expectations.
Burps loudly and without inhibition in front of others, showing social awkwardness and lack of situational awareness.
Attempts to connect with Michael playfully despite Michael's cold behavior, showing emotional intelligence and social persistence.
Requests to be tucked in like a child, showing dependence and difficulty with independence.
Insists on being tucked in and promises to go right to sleep, showing vulnerability and trust.
Initiates tickle fight with Walter despite Walter's reluctance.
Says "I love you" and repeatedly asks about Walter's love, showing sincere longing for affection.
Continuously calls for Dad in the dark despite being ignored and door slamming, showing persistence and openness but possibly overbearing.
Prepares a huge, elaborate breakfast with enthusiasm and offers generously to Emily.
Persistently asks for attention and reassurance from his father, repeatedly flicking the light and calling out despite warnings to go to sleep.
Successfully prepares a huge breakfast with elaborate setup, including cooking spaghetti and creating a painted rocking horse in the same morning.
Built a rocking horse out of dismantled entertainment center to surprise the family.
Made and packed spaghetti lunches with names in calligraphy for family members.
Asked why family doesn't hug in the morning and expressed a desire for closeness.
Persistently planned a day together emphasizing affection and shared activities.
Builds a rocking horse in forty minutes using available materials, demonstrates practical creativity and time management.
Dismantles the entertainment center for wood without considering consequences, resulting in household disruption.
Prepares breakfast and packs lunches with care and presentation (calligraphy), showing thoughtful planning and effort.
Attempts to engage others in conventional social habits (hugging), but misreads social cues and adult responses.
Plans the day in detail on an Etch-a-sketch, showing organization but in a childlike way that is socially naive considering others' commitments.
Takes off green tights despite discomfort to respect neighbor concerns.
Admits he has worn the costume his whole life showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Tries to communicate about an emergency by calling Walter and expressing concern about a noise.
Initially insists the radiator is evil but then acknowledges Walter was right, showing openness and trustworthiness.
Encourages Michael to keep making snowballs and leads the defense with enthusiasm.
Protects Michael by intercepting an incoming snowball to save him from harm.
Charges the opponent and accepts his surrender but then playfully hits him with a snowball without malice.
Shows ignorance of the meaning of 'surrendered', indicating innocence and sincerity.
Goofs around and plays dodge ball with Michael, creating a fun and friendly interaction.
Expresses sincere wish that his Dad were present, calling him the greatest dad in the world.
Dismissively says Dad is 'on the naughty list' in response to criticism.
Tells Jovie she is beautiful and that he feels warm when he's around her.
Flips out nervously when Jovie approaches and initially wants to leave.
Asks Jovie out on a date in a sincere, friendly manner despite awkwardness.
Uses playful humor to engage Jovie (refers to dating as 'the code').
Flips out and tries to leave when Jovie approaches, shows nervousness and lack of social confidence.
Manages to start a conversation with Jovie despite nervousness, uses a playful code about eating food to ask her out.
Explains his connection to Michael even when left alone, keeping the interaction going.
Expresses awkward feelings openly and honestly, makes Jovie embarrassed but intrigued.
Misunderstands or is slow to catch the social cues (e.g., about the food/code), yet recovers gracefully.
Shows clear excitement and confidence in accepting the date when invited.
Chops down a large Christmas tree in the park to bring holiday cheer.
Secures the tree to the floor to make sure it stays in place.
Plans to place the star on top of the tree in a playful and fun way despite risks.
Greets co-workers cheerfully, compliments Sarah's purple dress sincerely, and enthusiastically interacts with Francisco.
Insists on wearing his hat despite Walter's disapproval, but offers to try wearing it without resentment.
Compliments Deb's face warmly and sincerely, suggesting she should be on a Christmas card.
Runs and crashes into the wall and falls behind the couch.
Reassures others by saying 'I'm okay' after falling.
Finds a quarter after falling.
Wears a suit and enters office looking professional.
Engages colleagues with friendly greetings and compliments, despite awkwardness.
Refuses to remove his hat despite a negative reaction, showing confidence in own preferences.
Quickly dismisses multiple books as boring without deeper engagement.
Responds quickly and cheerfully to the phone greeting with enthusiasm, asking 'What's your favorite color?'
Asks questions to understand his surroundings and situation (e.g., why Walter's name is on the door)
Accepts instructions and follows along without complaint or resistance when introduced to the mail room and work tasks despite being frightened
Mentions that the mail room reminds him of Santa's workshop, showing positive and friendly associations even in a rough environment
Beats Walter to the ringing phone and answers quickly with an enthusiastic greeting.
Immediately decides ten different books are boring without much investigation.
Understands sarcasm when Walter jokes about his name on the door.
Asks questions to clarify the situation about the office and mailroom.
Dreams about shiny bins, indicating naive excitement rather than practical focus.
Complies promptly and respectfully to the floor manager's instructions in a new and intimidating environment.
Stuffs and launches mail into tubes with incredible speed and efficiency.
Almost unconsciously sings to himself while working, losing some focus.
Leads the mailroom workers in singing a cheerful rendition of 'The Twelve Days of Christmas,' spreading joy and camaraderie among coworkers.
Continues singing alone after coworkers stop when Walter arrives, still smiling at his dad despite the lack of reciprocation.
Leads the mailroom workers in singing enthusiastically, spreading cheer and engaging everyone.
Keeps singing alone after others stop, despite his father's disapproval.
Compliments Jovie sincerely by calling her miraculous.
Plays a light-hearted game with Jovie involving blindfolded coffee tasting, making her smile.
Enjoys simple, joyful moments like running around a revolving door and shares excitement about Christmas decorations with Jovie.
Persists in engaging with Jovie despite others showing annoyance, showing patience and enthusiasm.
Shares a genuine smile with Jovie upon seeing the Rockefeller Center Christmas tree, indicating sincere positive connection.
Engages in playful ice skating with Jovie, responds warmly to physical contact, and plants a kiss on her cheek.
Presses the buzzer confidently to find Jovie's apartment despite initial fear.
Sets up a coffee surprise with a blindfolded taste test, showing thought and playful planning.
Runs around a revolving door, enjoying himself though annoying others; behavior is silly and distracted.
Recognizes and shows enthusiasm for large holiday decorations, demonstrating appreciation but no specific skill.
Engages in playful ice skating with Jovie, responding well to mishaps and maintaining fun mood.
Accepts Jovie's full kiss and feels his heart fill his chest.
Steps into the door frame with purpose and confidence, appearing as a changed man, skipping happily down the street.
Excitedly declares being in love, openly expresses feelings.
Makes humorous comment about Miles Finch's small stature to lighten mood.
Jokes about candy canes not measuring up to Elf standards.
Interrupts serious discussion repeatedly, ignores social cues to stop.
Avoids physical fight when attacked by Miles, looks horrified after hitting him.
Tries to face his father despite being rejected and yelled at.
Runs off upset after harsh rejection from his father.
Tried to avoid Miles' attack but was flipped over the table.
Lands a punch on Miles in self-defense, but looks horrified at his own action.
After being hit multiple times and knocked down, he does not retaliate further.
Attempts to stand up and face his father despite being upset and scared.
Runs off devastated after his father's harsh rejection.
Writes a sincere apology letter expressing remorse for ruining others' lives and feeling like he doesn't belong anywhere.
Trudges through a stormy night alone in his elf suit, showing vulnerability but no hostility or bitterness.
Writes a neatly composed, perfectly calligraphed farewell letter, showing care and skill in communication.
Seals the letter carefully with a snow globe, demonstrating thoughtful attention to detail.
Trudges alone through a stormy night in an inappropriate outfit (Elf Suit), showing lack of practical judgment.
Feels he ruined others' lives and believes he doesn't belong anywhere, indicating low self-confidence and self-doubt.
Trudges through the stormy night in his elf suit despite harsh weather.
Walking determinedly through a stormy night in his elf suit, despite harsh conditions.
Leaves a note and his snow globe behind, disappearing unexpectedly and causing others distress.
Contemplates jumping off the bridge, tearful but does not go through with it.
Runs frantically to help Santa after witnessing the crash.
Feels despair and contemplates the worst but notices Santa's sleigh, showing awareness and alertness despite emotional distress.
Runs frantic to Santa's crash site and approaches to help despite the chaotic situation.
Expresses doubt about his own abilities saying 'But I'm not an Elf, I can't do anything right.'
Agrees to help Santa in fixing the sleigh engine, showing willingness to assist.
Runs off immediately to find the broken sleigh engine to help Santa.
Runs eagerly to Walter and Michael, shares urgent news, accepts Michael's hug
Leads others to Santa's grounded sleigh and reindeer, helps reveal truth
Trips and falls on his face while running, appearing clumsy and uncoordinated.
Leads Walter and Michael to Santa's grounded sleigh and reindeer, effectively guiding them to an important discovery.
Runs into the woods after falling, showing persistence despite setbacks.
Pulls Walter aside and comes up with a plan to help Santa
Stops Santa from chasing Michael and takes command to protect Santa
Admits he hasn't fixed the engine under the sleigh yet but continues trying.
Jumps in to help when the sleigh won't fly and encourages belief in Santa
Jumps in to help move the sleigh despite difficult conditions.
Reacting with confusion to Santa's joke indicating misunderstanding of humor.
Risks his life working frantically to fix the sleigh's engine to save Christmas
Celebrates his accomplishment loudly, showing pride and joy
Risking his life, works on a complicated engine under intense pressure and manages to get it working, propelling the sleigh over an obstacle.
Despite initial success, the engine gets ripped out causing the sleigh to crash, indicating a possible lack of thoroughness or foresight in his repair.
Saves Christmas with a joyful spirit that uplifts others
Writes and promotes a children’s book sharing his heartfelt story

Walter slaps away Buddy's hand

Works in a mail room before rising to recognition, indicating steady effort but limited initial skill.
